name: DDM
Info: Dynamic Dispatch Model. Detailed model of generation and investment decision-making in the electricity market in Great Britain

name: FIDER
Info: FID Enabling for Renewables affordability model. The Affordability Model fulfils two functions:it determines which projects are able to be funded given the budget set aside for FID Enabling for Renewables and it calculates the fair value of the total liabilities associated with the contracts that are let through the FID Enabling for Renewables process.

name: LCM
Info: Electricity Levelised Cost Model. Levelised cost of generation is the lifetime discounted cost of an asset expressed in cost per unit energy produced.

name: APBM
Info: The Average Prices and Bills Model estimates the average impact of energy and climate change policies on energy prices and bills for households and businesses

name: EEP
Info: The UEP model is the modelling framework for DECC's Energy & Emissions projections. It is actually a suite of models - at its core is the Energy Demand Model (EDM), which projects energy demands and the disaggregated greenhouse gas emissions for the United Kingdom up to 2030 (and soon 2035).

name: DIMPSA
Info: DIMPSA models the costs and benefits of policy delivery in terms of energy bills

name: BEAC
Info: This is a spreadsheet model created by Anna Stephenson for David MacKay to calculate global biomass resource and GHG impacts of electricity generation to 2050 incorporating evidenced counterfactual land use effects

name: BEAT2
Info: The Biomass Environmental Assessment Tool (BEAT2), provided by Defra, the Biomass Energy Centre and the Environment Agency as an aid to assessing the likely environmental impact of a biomass energy project

name: GLOBIOM
Info: A global model to assess competition for land use between agriculture, bioenergy, and forestry

name: GLOCAF
Info: The Global Carbon Finance (GLOCAF) model is used by analysts in DECC's International Climate Change (ICC) directorate for analysis of international climate change mitigation issues

name: EHS 2011
Info: The English Housing Survey is a continuous national survey that collects information about people's housing circumstances and the condition and energy efficiency of housing in England. The EHS covers all housing tenures and provides valuable information and evidence to inform the development and monitoring of government housing policies
